description: This easy vegan white bread is ideal for sandwiches, toast and as a side dish for soup. Fluffy and soft, it's easy to make using just 6 simple and accessible ingredients. Eggless and dairy-free.
keywords: bread, Dough, earth of maria, Flour, homemade bread, to move, vegan bread
name: Easy Vegan White Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Add the plant based milk, yeast, salt, and sugar to a mixing bowl. Stir together, cover the bowl with a dish cloth and set aside for the yeast to bloom for around 10 minutes.
Gradually add the flour around 1/2 cup at a time and mix it in using a rubber spatula. Once you have added all the flour, add the vegan butter and mix once more until thoroughly combined.
Knead the dough using your hands for around 10 minutes, until smooth and stretchy. It should feel sticky, but not wet.
Cover the bowl with a dish cloth and set aside in a warm place to proof for 30 minutes, until roughly doubled in size.
Transfer the dough to a lightly-floured surface. Use your hands to stretch it out into a rectangle, then fold it in on both sides. Next, roll it up tightly into a log around 25cm in length.
Lightly grease a loaf tin with butter or olive oil. Place the dough inside, cover and allow to proof for an hour more. During this time, it should roughly double in size once again.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C/350 F.
Bake the bread in the preheated oven for around 25-30 minutes. When done, remove the bread from the oven and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.
